data.title: Pangram Checker
data.statement:
A Pangram is a sentence that contains all the letters of the alphabet.

You will be given a string [[i]].
If [[i]] is an pangram, print {{Pangram}}.
If it is not, print all the letters <<not>> present in [[i]], in <<alphabetical order>>, separated by a <<space>>.
If there are any special characters, just ignore them.

For example: if you get {{#sphinx_of_black_quartz?!}} the program should print {{d e g j m s v w y}}

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn: the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn: jock nymphs waqf drug vex blit

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testOut: d e g j m v w y

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: pack my box with five dozen liquor jugs!

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn: how vexingly quick daft zebras jump

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testOut: d g n q r v w x y

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testOut: b f j k l p q u v x y z

data.constraints:
22 ≤ length of [[i]] ≤ 43
[[i]] may contain any characters except uppercase letters.
data.outputDescription: {{Pangram}} if [[i]] is a pangram or <<[the remaining characters separated by spaces]>> if not.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A Pangram is a sentence that contains all the letters of the alphabet.

You will be given a string i.
If i is an pangram, print Pangram.
If it is not, print all the letters not present in i, in alphabetical order, separated by a space.
If there are any special characters, just ignore them.

For example: if you get #sphinx_of_black_quartz?! the program should print d e g j m s v w y
Input
A string i
Output
Pangram if i is a pangram or [the remaining characters separated by spaces] if not.
Constraints
22 ≤ length of i ≤ 43
i may contain any characters except uppercase letters.
Example
Input
the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
Output
Pangram
